hints.content: To divide a shape in fourths, we divide the whole into **$4$ equal parts**.

This rectangle is not divided into $4$ pieces:  

![A rectangle has 4 vertical lines dividing it into 5 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/692ce061a1556c2d438a47235f9588b4d4c05c6b)

This rectangle is divided into $4$ pieces, but the pieces are not  equal in size:  

![A rectangle has 1 vertical line and 1 horizontal line dividing it into 4 unequal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/017c8db7c5f42e50941d95d08644612e1ef20a0f)

These rectangles are divided into fourths:  

![A rectangle has 1 vertical line and 1 horizontal line dividing it into 4 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4443ddd49d529942cdc5b1c92754421464ab5c74)
![A rectangle has 3 vertical lines dividing it into 4 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/65b4eb38c8880ca3a8423f075a78c78a9589bd1f)

question.content:
**Which rectangles are divided into fourths?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 2]]

choices.content: ![A rectangle has 1 vertical line and 1 horizontal line dividing it into 4 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4443ddd49d529942cdc5b1c92754421464ab5c74)
![A rectangle has 1 vertical line and 1 horizontal line dividing it into 4 unequal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/017c8db7c5f42e50941d95d08644612e1ef20a0f)
![A rectangle has 3 vertical lines dividing it into 4 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/65b4eb38c8880ca3a8423f075a78c78a9589bd1f)
![A rectangle has 4 vertical lines dividing it into 5 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/692ce061a1556c2d438a47235f9588b4d4c05c6b)
